metadata.title: CVE-2023-52827 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: wifi:ath12k: fix possible out-of-bound read in ath12k_htt_pull_ppdu_stats() lenis extracted from HTT message and could be an unexpected value in caseerrors happen, so add validation before using to avoid possibleout-of-bound read in the following message iteration and parsing. The sameissue also applies to ppdu_info->ppdu_stats.common.num_users, so validateit before using too. These are found during code review. Compile test only.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52827` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.6.0-14-generic - 6.6.0-14.14
linux-image-unsigned-6.6.0-14-generic - 6.6.0-14.14
linux-image-unsigned-6.6.0-14-generic-64k - 6.6.0-14.14
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.6.0-1001-aws - 6.6.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.6.0-1001-azure - 6.6.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.6.0-1001-gcp - 6.6.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-gke - 6.8.0-1003.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1001-ibm - 6.8.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.6.0-14-lowlatency - 6.6.0-14.14.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.6.0-14-lowlatency-64k - 6.6.0-14.14.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.6.0-1001-oracle - 6.6.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-6.7.0-1001-raspi - 6.7.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-oem - 6.8.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-intel - 6.8.0-1001.6
No subscription required
